title: Ticket #4598: Export python functions to ClassAd library
description:
Now that we can convert easily between ClassAd types and python types, we should extend the ClassAd language using python functions. Here's what I'd like to see (python snippet): 

def myAdd(a, b):
  return a+b

classads.register(myAdd)
print classads.ExprTree('myAdd(1, 2)').eval()

This would greatly improve our ability to easily extend the ClassAd language. An example of a potential use case would be glideinWMS, where the matching functions are complex enough that they threw away ClassAds and just shove things in python.
remarks:

This feature is in the 8.3.2 and later series. It was cherry-picked back to the 8.2.7 branch and subsequently reverted from that branch.
